title: 106_s2821
content: The Act may be cited as the "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000". It addresses the creditability of service. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 amends Section 8411(b) of title 5, United States Code to include service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation performed between December 31, 1988, and June 30, 2000, of at least 1 year's duration, if the individual later becomes subject to this chapter. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 amends Section 8411 of title 5, United States Code to require employees or Members to deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between December 31, 1988, and June 30, 2000, if they later become subject to this chapter. Employees or Members are required to deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for temporary or intermittent service at the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between December 31, 1988, and June 30, 2000. Any deposit made more than 5 years later will include interest, and if the deposit is not made in full, the service will still be creditable but the annuity will be reduced. Employees or Members must deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for temporary or intermittent service at the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between December 31, 1988, and June 30, 2000. Service is fully creditable, but any resulting annuity will be reduced similar to section 8418(b). SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO PERSONS WHO HAVE SEPARATED. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given upon submission of a written application by December 31, 2001. Any annuity or survivor annuity will be recalculated to include the service described in the regulations. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. An annuity will be recomputed to include any service described in section 8411(b)(6) of title 5, United States Code, effective for amounts accruing more than 30 days after the application is submitted. If the full deposit required under section 8411(j) is not timely made, a reduction will be made in the recomputed annuity. Interest is not included in the deposit. The Office of Personnel Management will notify individuals of their rights under the Act and assist in obtaining necessary information from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Corporation will provide information on an individual's service to the Office upon request.
